meanings.definition: To cut off (a limb), especially by surgery.
meanings.sent1: The doctor was amputating the injured leg to save the patient's life.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon will be amputating the arm to prevent the spread of infection.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly thought it was amputating a tree branch instead of a limb.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the character was amputating obstacles to clear the path.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the saw amputating the wood echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: To remove by or as if by cutting.
meanings.sent1: She was amputating the excess fabric from the dress to make it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The chef was amputating the spoiled parts of the fruit before using it in the salad.
meanings.sent3: The tailor joked that he was amputating the ugly design from the shirt.
meanings.sent4: The editor was amputating unnecessary words from the manuscript to improve clarity.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was amputating the dead branches to help the tree thrive.
